sections.text: 02 – Meeting 06-FEB-26 Run of Show

-   Motion + vote (quick).
-   **Chair note:** “Today we will leave with three artifacts: Definitions & Assumptions, Priority Misconceptions, Draft Grade Bands.”
-   Motion + vote.
-   Capture constraints that affect grade bands / tool access / comms.

heading_path: 0:15–0:27 — Team Alignment artifacts + Team Charter v1 (review)
sections.text: **Purpose:** show the work you did from the questionnaire; socialize changes; tee up a clean vote.

-   3–5 bullets from questionnaire synthesis (patterns, not individuals).
-   1 slide or 1 Miro frame: “What this changes in how we work.”

-   Team Alignment Map (30–60 sec)
-   Team Contract (60 sec)
-   Roles & Leads (60 sec)
-   Team Charter v1 changes vs v0.9 (60 sec)

heading_path: 0:22–0:27 (5 min) — Team Charter v1 discussion + vote
sections.text:
-   Prompt: “Any must-fix edits for clarity/scope/decision method?”
-   Park “nice-to-haves” unless truly material.
-   Motion: “Approve Team Charter v1 as committee operating charter.”
-   Vote + record.

Where it “fits” in the standing agenda: It’s a **Decision** that enables the focus work. Putting it at the *front* prevents procedural churn later.

heading_path: 0:27–0:50 — Focus block (Shared baseline: capabilities/limits + classroom reality)
sections.text:
Goal: produce the three “leave the room with” outputs.

**Structure:** 3 sprints + 1 quick converge.

heading_path: 0:27–0:50 — Focus block (Shared baseline: capabilities/limits + classroom reality)
Sprint A (0:27–0:34) — Common vocabulary (Definitions + Assumptions sheet)
sections.text:
-   In-room method: small groups each own 1–2 terms, then reconcile.
-   Terms to lock (from your outline):
    -   “AI” (general), “generative,” “reasoning,” “tool vs tutor”
    -   “copilot vs autopilot”
-   Output contribution: definitions + 3–5 assumptions (e.g., “AI output can be wrong/confident,” “models vary,” “district tools differ from consumer tools,” etc.)

heading_path: 0:27–0:50 — Focus block (Shared baseline: capabilities/limits + classroom reality)
Sprint B (0:34–0:41) — “Myths to kill” → priority misconceptions
sections.text:
-   Prompt: “What are the 8–12 misconceptions that will hurt implementation unless we address them?”
-   Include your starting set:
    -   “glorified search”
    -   “detectors solve integrity”
    -   “AI is always wrong/right”
-   Output contribution: ranked list (top tier vs parking lot)

heading_path: 0:27–0:50 — Focus block (Shared baseline: capabilities/limits + classroom reality)
Sprint C (0:41–0:47) — 3 classroom scenarios + quick grade-band implications
sections.text:
-   Scenarios (from your outline):
    1.  student use
    2.  teacher use
    3.  assessment integrity (quick triage)
-   For each: “Allowed / constrained / not allowed (default)” + “What changes by grade band?”

heading_path: 0:27–0:50 — Focus block (Shared baseline: capabilities/limits + classroom reality)
sections.text:
-   Decide the **structure** (not every detail):
    -   PK–2 / 3–5 / 6–8 / 9–12 (or whatever FCCPS prefers)
-   Output contribution: “Draft grade bands for policy guidance structure” (one line each)

heading_path: 0:50–0:57 — Decisions made + action items + parking lot
sections.text:
-   Confirm **what was decided**:
    -   Team Charter v1 approved
    -   Definitions v0.1 approved (or “published as working draft”)
    -   Misconceptions v0.1 approved (or “working draft”)
    -   Grade bands draft selected
-   Assign owners for between-meeting refinement of each artifact.
-   Preview: between-meeting “Top 3 risks + top 3 opportunities” intake.

heading_path: 2) Pre-work + pre-reads (so the focus block actually lands)
What you post to Miro before the meeting (read-only for members)
sections.text: Create **one “Meeting 2” landing frame** with links to sub-frames:

-   AI:
-   Generative AI:
-   Reasoning system:
-   Tool vs tutor:
-   Copilot vs autopilot:
-   Attribution (in student work):
-   Assessment integrity:
-   {Misconception}

-   Default posture:
-   Allowed examples:
-   Constrained examples:
-   Not allowed examples:
-   What changes by grade band:

Scenario 2: Teacher use (instructional + professional)  
(same prompts)

-   Biggest risk:
-   Default guardrail candidates:
-   What changes by grade band:
You’re right: introduce it briefly *in the meeting* so it doesn’t feel like surprise homework.

“Between now and Meeting 3, we’re collecting each member’s top 3 risks and top 3 opportunities. We’ll synthesize and bring a combined view into our values/principles session so we’re debating real tradeoffs, not abstractions.”

-   **1:1 submission to co-chairs** (as you already outlined)
-   Encourage concise format:
    -   Risk: \__\_ \| Why it matters: \__\_ \| Possible mitigation: \__\_
    -   Opportunity: \__\_ \| Value unlocked: \__\_ \| What we’d need: \__\_

-   Risk: low response rate → weak synthesis → Meeting 3 loses traction
-   Mitigation**:** set a firm deadline + make it “small”
    -   Deadline: **Tue 10 Feb, 5pm** (gives you time to synthesize)
    -   Limit: **3 bullets each**, not paragraphs

source_rel_path: Meetings/02 - Meeting 06-FEB-26/01 Updated 60-minute agenda (with Team Charter vote).md
title: 1) Updated 60-minute agenda (with Team Charter vote)
